DOC.brief_summary: Interventional Study Early Postoperative Cognitive Dysfunction Elderly Patients Undergoing General Anesthesia The main purpose study determine incidence early postoperative cognitive dysfunction elderly patient time course . This study first evaluate preoperative cognitive function elderly patient base several criterion include complete patient history , laboratory instrumental exam , follow measure order identify condition pathology may influence cognitive function . - Mini Mental State Examination - Geriatric Index Comorbidity - Geriatric Depression Scale The following neuropsychological test perform day within 7 day surgery ( baseline ) : - Trail Making Test B-A - Digit Span - Digit Symbol Substitution Test The three cognitive function assessment repeat follow postoperative time point change preoperative baseline time evaluate : - Day 2 ( time point 1 ) - Day 4 ( time point 2 ) - Between day 85 90 ( time point 3 ) If patient seem confused postoperative administration test , Neecham Confusion Scale use evaluate patient presence postoperative delirium ; delirium detect , cognitive function test administer .
DOC.detailed_description: This study three specific aim : 1 . To define frequency occurrence early post-operative cognitive dysfunction time course . 2 . To assess risk factor onset post-operative cognitive dysfunction possible causal factor . 3. compare result international literature .
